page.title: 16RECREATION _ NORTH DOWNS
page.content: This beautiful area is very popular for horse riding because of the availability of grazing land and stables. There are numerous bridle- ways and narrow lanes, and people come even from London for some peaceful hacking. The chalk hills and woodland have an extremely rich flora and fauna and therefore the area is frequently visited by botanists, ornithologists and sketching enthusiasts; school parties often come for nature rambles. In spring late night walks are arranged to hear the nightingales, while in autumn fruit pickers come for mushrooms, cob nuts and other hedgerow berries. The steep scarp of the North Downs at Holly Hill is ideally suited for flying kites and model planes, and for picnicking and dog walking.
